entry.title: Dumb Woman's Lane (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Paul McCartney wrote a poem about Dumb Woman's Lane (pictured)?

entry.title: Sofia Vakman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Sofia Vakman relinquished a career as a concert pianist because a skin disorder she contracted after swimming made it painful for her to play?

entry.title: shining St John's wort (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the shining St John's wort owes its bright colors partly to carotenoid compounds?

entry.title: Jessica Mutch McKay (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jessica Mutch McKay hosted debates between the leaders of New Zealand's two major political parties?

entry.title: WNBA seasons (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that some WNBA seasons, including this year's, have a break for the Summer Olympic Games?

entry.title: Richard Smith (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that public historian Richard Smith called Henry David Thoreau the "first punk rocker"?

entry.title: The Anxious City (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that The Anxious City introduced a recurring figure in Paul Delvaux's paintings: a man who is ignorant of the pretty women and disasters around him?

entry.title: Andy Dickerson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that offensive lineman Andy Dickerson is not to be confused with offensive lineman Andy Dickerson?
